radiographic_examinations.findings: Stool and residual contrast material is visualized in the colon which is dilated to a maximal diameter of 10.5 cm at the cecum. The small bowel is air-filled but not dilated. A single air-fluid level is seen in the stomach. Cholecystectomy clips and a surgical drain are seen projecting over the right upper quadrant. Fiducial markers are seen within the pelvis. Residual contrast is seen within the bladder. Peritoneal free air is within expected post-operative limits.
